entry.title: Hello World 2.0
entry.content:
There we are. I have finally gotten around to rebuilding my blog. I’ve been mearning to do that for a couple of months, but there’s been a lot going on lately so I haven’t had the time. Until now. I must say that I’m quite satisfied how it turned out. There are still a couple of things I want to add to it, like a commenting feature, but I’ll get to that Later.

Now, I know I’ve been worse at posting here than a cat is at barking, but I’m hoping to change that because I’ve got a lot going on! First things first, I’m planning to work my way though all the books I buy for decoration, I mean never get around to reading. What’s more is that I’m going to review them here too! That means that I’ll both start reading and posting more! Win-win!

Apart from reviewing printed teachings (and the odd piece of fiction maybe) I also have a couple of hardware projects coming up which I’m going to share with you guys. So hopefully there’ll be a lot going on here on the blog in the future!

Right now I have to go to sleep though, so I’ll see you next time!

Happy Hacking!

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Hello, and welcome to my blog! My name is Erik Bergenholtz, and I am a security enthusiast and hacker living in Sweden. I hope to expand my website in the future, but for now this blog will have to do.

As I mentioned, I am a security enthusiast and hacker. I mostly enjoy computer security, but physical security such as burglary alarms and lock smithing is also quite amusing. This is what my blog will be about; security, hacking, projects and perhaps the odd contemplation.

I am not sure what else to write in this first post, so I’ll just leave it at that. I’m looking forward to sharing some of my projects, and I hope you’ll enjoy reading about them.

Until then, happy hacking!
